Description: Small fragment of cloth in undyed linen with narrow bands of coloured wool; four in red wool, each c.6mm deep, and at the bottom of the fragment, one of mustard yellow (incomplete); ground is plain weave and bands in extended plain weave - every 4th thread dropped giving grouping of 1:2:1:2 etc; warp-undyed linen (S/c.18), weft-undyed linen (S/c.12) and red and yellow wool (S/c.8-10); edges ragged or torn; not clear if from a garment or furnishing; from the body of a mummy found on the Northern Brick Pyramid of Dashur
Curator's comments: presented in 1840; Birch Slip gives provenance as "Northern Brick Pyramid of Dashour"; this fragment may be older than the hair-nets 6651a); method of grouping the warp with dropped rather than crossed threads is unusual in Coptic textiles; From the body of a mummy found upon the Northern Brick Pyramid of Dashur
Acquisition name: Donated by: Col R W Howard Vyse
